de.mrapp.android.dialog.decorator

Class ProgressDialogDecorator

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.dialog.decorator.AbstractDialogDecorator<ButtonBarDialog>
      • de.mrapp.android.dialog.decorator.ProgressDialogDecorator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Dialog, ProgressDialogDecorator

    public class ProgressDialogDecorator
extends AbstractDialogDecorator<ButtonBarDialog>
implements ProgressDialogDecorator
    A decorator, which allows to modify the view hierarchy of a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and allows to indicate a running progress.
    Since:
    3.2.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ProgressDialogDecorator(ButtonBarDialog dialog)
      Creates a new decorator, which allows to modify the view hierarchy of a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and allows to indicate a running progress.

      Returns the size of the dialog's progress bar.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProgressDialogDecorator

        public ProgressDialogDecorator(@NonNull
                               ButtonBarDialog dialog)
        Creates a new decorator, which allows to modify the view hierarchy of a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and allows to indicate a running progress.
        Parameters:
        dialog - The dialog, whose view hierarchy should be modified by the decorator, as an instance of the type ButtonBarDialog. The dialog may not be null
